message.content:
<<<api>>>: MediaPlayer
<<<code>>>: @TargetApi(Build.VERSION_CODES.HONEYCOMB)
public class MainActivity extends ActionBarActivity {
    public MediaPlayer mediaPlayer;

    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);
        getActionBar().hide();
        mediaPlayer = new MediaPlayer();
    }

    public void playB() throws IOException {
        playSound(R.raw.b);
    }

    public void playSound(int resId) throws IOException {
        Uri uri = Uri.parse("android.resource://com.max.bead/" + resId);
        if(mediaPlayer.isPlaying()) {
            mediaPlayer.stop();
        } else {
            mediaPlayer.setDataSource(getApplicationContext(), uri);
            mediaPlayer.prepare();
            mediaPlayer.start();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code you provided has a few syntax errors. Here is the corrected code:
- The line "super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);" was commented out, but it should be uncommented as it is necessary to call the superclass's onCreate method.
- The line "playB() throws IOException {" is not valid syntax. Instead, you should define the method without the "throws IOException" part.
- The line "URI uri = URI.parse("android://com.max.bead/" + resId);" should be changed to "Uri uri = Uri.parse("android.resource://com.max.bead/" + resId);". The correct syntax for creating a Uri object is "Uri.parse()".
- The line "mediaPlayer.play();" should be changed to "mediaPlayer.start();". The correct method to start playing the media is "start()".

As for learning resources, here are a few recommendations:
- Oracle's Java Tutorials: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/
- Codecademy's Java Course: https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-java
- Udemy's Java Programming Masterclass for Software Developers: https://www.udemy.com/course/java-the-complete-java-developer-course/
